author: Michael Larabel
description: The Non-Volatile Memory Device (NVDIMM) subsystem updates were merged today for the in-development Linux 6.19 kernel. Most notable this cycle for the NVDIMM code is a new open-source driver addition courtesy of Microsoft...
title: Microsoft's RAMDAX Driver Merged For Linux 6.19 To Carve Out RAM As NVDIMM Devices

author: Michael Larabel
description: Making for a bit more exciting weekend is that minutes ago AMD has posted their first patch for enabling Zen 6 processor support within the GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) for -march=znver6 targeting...
title: AMD Starts Enabling Zen 6 "znver6" Compiler Support In GCC

author: Michael Larabel
description: The latest improvement to the RadeonSI Gallium3D driver by prominent AMD Mesa developer Marek Olšák is enabling support for up to 64K x 64K textures with RDNA4 GPUs...
title: Mesa 26.0 Bringing Support For 64K x 64K Textures With AMD RDNA4 GPUs

author: Michael Larabel
description: FEX 2512 is out toda as the newest monthly update for this software that enables running x86/x86_64 Linux binaries on ARM64 Linux, including the likes of Wine and Valve's Steam Play (Proton) for being able to run Windows games on 64-bit ARM Linux devices...
title: FEX 2512 Released With More Improvements For Gaming On ARM64 Linux

author: Michael Larabel
description: Flowblade 2.24 released today as the newest version of this open-source, non-linear video editing application. Flowblade 2.24 brings a number of refinements while also interesting is their commentary concerning the future with Wayland and GTK4 porting...
title: Flowblade Video Editor May Go Wayland-Only As Part Of GTK4 Port

author: Michael Larabel
description: For anyone still relying on Solaris in production or just nostalgic Solaris users from the grand Sun Microsystems days, Solaris 11.4 SRU 87 was released by Oracle this week as one of the heavier stable release updates in recent memory...
title: Solaris 11.4 SRU 87 Released With New Security Features, GCC 15

author: Michael Larabel
description: Beyond the main set of Rust changes to land in Linux 6.19 earlier this week, as we near the end of the first week of two for the Linux 6.19 merge window... More Rust changes. This time around the driver core updates for the kernel bring a number of Rust changes...
title: Linux 6.19 Brings Many Driver Core Changes For Rust, Housekeeping CPUs Exposed

author: Michael Larabel
description: It was a busy start of December for KDE Plasma developers in working out several hardware fixes for the current Plasma 6.5 series while also working on new Plasma 6.6 features like the per-DRM-plane color pipelines...
title: KDE Plasma 6.6 Supporting Per-DRM-Plane Color Pipelines, More Hardware Quirks/Fixes
